name: AsyncWriter
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter
description:
AsyncWriter

An object that batches and transmits log entries asynchronously.

Use this object to transmit log entries efficiently. It keeps a queue of log entries, and runs a background thread that transmits them to the logging service in batches. Generally, adding to the queue will not block.

This object is thread-safe; it may accept write requests from multiple threads simultaneously, and will serialize them when executing in the background thread.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

async = logging.async_writer

entry1 = logging.entry payload: "Job started."
entry2 = logging.entry payload: "Job completed."

labels = { job_size: "large", job_code: "red" }
resource = logging.resource "gae_app",
                            "module_id" => "1",
                            "version_id" => "20150925t173233"

async.write_entries [entry1, entry2],
                    log_name: "my_app_log",
                    resource: resource,
                    labels: labels

methods.name: last_exception
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#last_exception
methods.description: The last exception thrown by the background thread, or nil if nothing has been thrown.

methods.name: write_entries
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#write_entries
methods.description:
Asynchronously write one or more log entries to the Stackdriver Logging service.

Unlike the main write_entries method, this method usually does not block. The actual write RPCs will happen in the background, and may be batched with related calls. However, if the queue is full, this method will block until enough space has cleared out.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
async = logging.async_writer

entry = logging.entry payload: "Job started.",
                      log_name: "my_app_log"
entry.resource.type = "gae_app"
entry.resource.labels[:module_id] = "1"
entry.resource.labels[:version_id] = "20150925t173233"

async.write_entries entry

params.name: entries
params.description:
One or more entry
objects to write. The log entries must have values for all required
fields.

params.name: log_name
params.description: A default log ID for those log entries in entries that do not specify their own log_name. See also Entry#log_name=.

params.name: resource
params.description: A default monitored resource for those log entries in entries that do not specify their own resource. See also Entry#resource.

params.name: labels
params.description: User-defined key:value items that are added to the labels field of each log entry in entries, except when a log entry specifies its own key:value item with the same key. See also Entry#labels=.

methods.name: stop
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#stop
methods.description:
Stops this asynchronous writer.

After this call succeeds, the state will change to :stopping, and you may not issue any additional write_entries calls. Any previously issued writes will complete. Once any existing backlog has been cleared, the state will change to :stopped.

returns.description:
Returns true if the writer was running, or false
if the writer had already been stopped.

methods.name: suspend
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#suspend
methods.description:
Suspends this asynchronous writer.

After this call succeeds, the state will change to :suspended, and the writer will stop sending RPCs until resumed.

returns.description:
Returns true if the writer had been running and was
suspended, otherwise false.

methods.name: resume
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#resume
methods.description:
Resumes this suspended asynchronous writer.

After this call succeeds, the state will change to :running, and the writer will resume sending RPCs.

returns.description:
Returns true if the writer had been suspended and
is now running, otherwise false.

methods.name: running?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#running?
methods.description: Returns true if this writer is running.

returns.description: Returns true if the writer is currently running.

methods.name: suspended?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#suspended?
methods.description: Returns true if this writer is suspended.

returns.description: Returns true if the writer is currently suspended.

methods.name: writable?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#writable?
methods.description: Returns true if this writer is still accepting writes. This means it is either running or suspended.

returns.description: Returns true if the writer is accepting writes.

methods.name: stopped?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#stopped?
methods.description: Returns true if this writer is fully stopped.

returns.description: Returns true if the writer is fully stopped.

methods.name: wait_until_stopped
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
AsyncWriter#wait_until_stopped
methods.description: Blocks until this asynchronous writer has been stopped, or the given timeout (if present) has elapsed.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout in seconds, or nil for no timeout.

returns.description:
Returns true if the writer is stopped, or false
if the timeout expired.
